fields.name: ProfileToken
fields.description: this command requests a specific profile

fields.name: Profile
fields.description: returns the requested media profile

fields.name: Name
fields.description: User readable name of the profile.

fields.name: VideoSourceConfiguration
fields.description: Optional configuration of the Video input.

fields.name: AudioSourceConfiguration
fields.description: Optional configuration of the Audio input.

fields.name: VideoEncoderConfiguration
fields.description: Optional configuration of the Video encoder.

fields.name: AudioEncoderConfiguration
fields.description: Optional configuration of the Audio encoder.

fields.name: VideoAnalyticsConfiguration
fields.description: Optional configuration of the video analytics module and rule engine.

fields.name: PTZConfiguration
fields.description: Optional configuration of the pan tilt zoom unit.

fields.name: MetadataConfiguration
fields.description: Optional configuration of the metadata stream.

fields.name: Extension
fields.description: Extensions defined in ONVIF 2.0

fields.name: token
fields.description: Unique identifier of the profile.

fields.name: fixed
fields.description: A value of true signals that the profile cannot be deleted. Default is false.

fields.name: SourceToken
fields.description: Reference to the physical input.

fields.name: Bounds
fields.description: Rectangle specifying the Video capturing area. The capturing area shall not be larger than the whole Video source area.

fields.name: ViewMode
fields.description: Readonly parameter signalling Source configuration's view mode, for devices supporting different view modes as defined in tt:viewModes.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: User readable name. Length up to 64 characters.

fields.name: UseCount
fields.description: Number of internal references currently using this configuration. This informational parameter is read-only. Deprecated for Media2 Service.

fields.name: token
fields.description: Token that uniquely references this configuration. Length up to 64 characters.

fields.name: Rotate
fields.description: Optional element to configure rotation of captured image.What resolutions a device supports shall be unaffected by the Rotate parameters.If a device is configured with Rotate=AUTO, the device shall take control over the Degree parameter and automatically update it so that a client can query current rotation.The device shall automatically apply the same rotation to its pan/tilt control direction depending on the following condition: if Reverse=AUTO in PTControlDirection or if the device doesnâ€™t support Reverse in PTControlDirection

fields.name: Mode
fields.description: Parameter to enable/disable Rotation feature.

fields.name: Degree
fields.description: Optional parameter to configure how much degree of clockwise rotation of image  for On mode. Omitting this parameter for On mode means 180 degree rotation.

fields.name: LensDescription
fields.description: Optional element describing the geometric lens distortion. Multiple instances for future variable lens support.

fields.name: SceneOrientation
fields.description: Optional element describing the scene orientation in the cameraâ€™s field of view.

fields.name: Offset
fields.description: Offset of the lens center to the imager center in normalized coordinates.

fields.name: Projection
fields.description: Radial description of the projection characteristics. The resulting curve is defined by the B-Spline interpolation over the given elements. The element for Radius zero shall not be provided. The projection points shall be ordered with ascending Radius. Items outside the last projection Radius shall be assumed to be invisible (black).

fields.name: XFactor
fields.description: Compensation of the x coordinate needed for the ONVIF normalized coordinate system.

fields.name: FocalLength
fields.description: Optional focal length of the optical system.

fields.name: x
fields.description: Optional horizontal offset of the lens center in normalized coordinates.

fields.name: y
fields.description: Optional vertical offset of the lens center in normalized coordinates.

fields.name: Angle
fields.description: Angle of incidence.

fields.name: Radius
fields.description: Mapping radius as a consequence of the emergent angle.

fields.name: Transmittance
fields.description: Optional ray absorption at the given angle due to vignetting. A value of one means no absorption.

fields.name: Mode
fields.description: Parameter to assign the way the camera determines the scene orientation.

fields.name: Orientation
fields.description: Assigned or determined scene orientation based on the Mode. When assigning the Mode to AUTO, this field is optional and will be ignored by the device. When assigning the Mode to MANUAL, this field is required and the device will return an InvalidArgs fault if missing.

fields.name: SourceToken
fields.description: Token of the Audio Source the configuration applies to

fields.name: Name
fields.description: User readable name. Length up to 64 characters.

fields.name: UseCount
fields.description: Number of internal references currently using this configuration. This informational parameter is read-only. Deprecated for Media2 Service.

fields.name: token
fields.description: Token that uniquely references this configuration. Length up to 64 characters.

fields.name: Encoding
fields.description: Used video codec, either Jpeg, H.264 or Mpeg4

fields.name: Resolution
fields.description: Configured video resolution

fields.name: Quality
fields.description: Relative value for the video quantizers and the quality of the video. A high value within supported quality range means higher quality

fields.name: RateControl
fields.description: Optional element to configure rate control related parameters.

fields.name: MPEG4
fields.description: Optional element to configure Mpeg4 related parameters.

fields.name: H264
fields.description: Optional element to configure H.264 related parameters.

fields.name: Multicast
fields.description: Defines the multicast settings that could be used for video streaming.

fields.name: SessionTimeout
fields.description: The rtsp session timeout for the related video stream

fields.name: GuaranteedFrameRate
fields.description: A value of true indicates that frame rate is a fixed value rather than an upper limit,and that the video encoder shall prioritize frame rate over all other adaptableconfiguration values such as bitrate.  Default is false.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: User readable name. Length up to 64 characters.

fields.name: UseCount
fields.description: Number of internal references currently using this configuration. This informational parameter is read-only. Deprecated for Media2 Service.

fields.name: token
fields.description: Token that uniquely references this configuration. Length up to 64 characters.

fields.name: Width
fields.description: Number of the columns of the Video image. If there is a 90-degree rotation, this represents the number of lines of the Video image.

fields.name: Height
fields.description: Number of the lines of the Video image. If there is a 90-degree rotation, this represents the number of columns of the Video image.

fields.name: FrameRateLimit
fields.description: Maximum output framerate in fps. If an EncodingInterval is provided the resulting encoded framerate will be reduced by the given factor.

fields.name: EncodingInterval
fields.description: Interval at which images are encoded and transmitted. (A value of 1 means that every frame is encoded, a value of 2 means that every 2nd frame is encoded ...)

fields.name: BitrateLimit
fields.description: the maximum output bitrate in kbps

fields.name: GovLength
fields.description: Determines the interval in which the I-Frames will be coded. An entry of 1 indicates I-Frames are continuously generated. An entry of 2 indicates that every 2nd image is an I-Frame, and 3 only every 3rd frame, etc. The frames in between are coded as P or B Frames.

fields.name: Mpeg4Profile
fields.description: the Mpeg4 profile, either simple profile (SP) or advanced simple profile (ASP)

fields.name: GovLength
fields.description: Group of Video frames length. Determines typically the interval in which the I-Frames will be coded. An entry of 1 indicates I-Frames are continuously generated. An entry of 2 indicates that every 2nd image is an I-Frame, and 3 only every 3rd frame, etc. The frames in between are coded as P or B Frames.

fields.name: H264Profile
fields.description: the H.264 profile, either baseline, main, extended or high

fields.name: Address
fields.description: The multicast address (if this address is set to 0 no multicast streaming is enaled)

fields.name: Port
fields.description: The RTP mutlicast destination port. A device may support RTCP. In this case the port value shall be even to allow the corresponding RTCP stream to be mapped to the next higher (odd) destination port number as defined in the RTSP specification.

fields.name: TTL
fields.description: In case of IPv6 the TTL value is assumed as the hop limit. Note that for IPV6 and administratively scoped IPv4 multicast the primary use for hop limit / TTL is to prevent packets from (endlessly) circulating and not limiting scope. In these cases the address contains the scope.

fields.name: AutoStart
fields.description: Read only property signalling that streaming is persistant. Use the methods StartMulticastStreaming and StopMulticastStreaming to switch its state.

fields.name: Encoding
fields.description: Audio codec used for encoding the audio input (either G.711, G.726 or AAC)

fields.name: Bitrate
fields.description: The output bitrate in kbps.

fields.name: SampleRate
fields.description: The output sample rate in kHz.

fields.name: Multicast
fields.description: Defines the multicast settings that could be used for video streaming.

fields.name: SessionTimeout
fields.description: The rtsp session timeout for the related audio stream

fields.name: Name
fields.description: User readable name. Length up to 64 characters.

fields.name: UseCount
fields.description: Number of internal references currently using this configuration. This informational parameter is read-only. Deprecated for Media2 Service.

fields.name: token
fields.description: Token that uniquely references this configuration. Length up to 64 characters.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: User readable name. Length up to 64 characters.

fields.name: UseCount
fields.description: Number of internal references currently using this configuration. This informational parameter is read-only. Deprecated for Media2 Service.

fields.name: token
fields.description: Token that uniquely references this configuration. Length up to 64 characters.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Item name.

fields.name: Value
fields.description: Item value. The type is defined in the corresponding description.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Item name.

fields.name: NodeToken
fields.description: A mandatory reference to the PTZ Node that the PTZ Configuration belongs to.

fields.name: DefaultAbsolutePantTiltPositionSpace
fields.description: If the PTZ Node supports absolute Pan/Tilt movements, it shall specify one Absolute Pan/Tilt Position Space as default.

fields.name: DefaultAbsoluteZoomPositionSpace
fields.description: If the PTZ Node supports absolute zoom movements, it shall specify one Absolute Zoom Position Space as default.

fields.name: DefaultRelativePanTiltTranslationSpace
fields.description: If the PTZ Node supports relative Pan/Tilt movements, it shall specify one RelativePan/Tilt Translation Space as default.

fields.name: DefaultRelativeZoomTranslationSpace
fields.description: If the PTZ Node supports relative zoom movements, it shall specify one Relative Zoom Translation Space as default.

fields.name: DefaultContinuousPanTiltVelocitySpace
fields.description: If the PTZ Node supports continuous Pan/Tilt movements, it shall specify one Continuous Pan/Tilt Velocity Space as default.

fields.name: DefaultContinuousZoomVelocitySpace
fields.description: If the PTZ Node supports continuous zoom movements, it shall specify one Continuous Zoom Velocity Space as default.

fields.name: DefaultPTZSpeed
fields.description: If the PTZ Node supports absolute or relative PTZ movements, it shall specify corresponding default Pan/Tilt and Zoom speeds.

fields.name: DefaultPTZTimeout
fields.description: If the PTZ Node supports continuous movements, it shall specify a default timeout, after which the movement stops.

fields.name: PanTiltLimits
fields.description: The Pan/Tilt limits element should be present for a PTZ Node that supports an absolute Pan/Tilt. If the element is present it signals the support for configurable Pan/Tilt limits. If limits are enabled, the Pan/Tilt movements shall always stay within the specified range. The Pan/Tilt limits are disabled by setting the limits to â€“INF or +INF.

fields.name: ZoomLimits
fields.description: The Zoom limits element should be present for a PTZ Node that supports absolute zoom. If the element is present it signals the supports for configurable Zoom limits. If limits are enabled the zoom movements shall always stay within the specified range. The Zoom limits are disabled by settings the limits to -INF and +INF.

fields.name: MoveRamp
fields.description: The optional acceleration ramp used by the device when moving.

fields.name: PresetRamp
fields.description: The optional acceleration ramp used by the device when recalling presets.

fields.name: PresetTourRamp
fields.description: The optional acceleration ramp used by the device when executing PresetTours.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: User readable name. Length up to 64 characters.

fields.name: UseCount
fields.description: Number of internal references currently using this configuration. This informational parameter is read-only. Deprecated for Media2 Service.

fields.name: token
fields.description: Token that uniquely references this configuration. Length up to 64 characters.

fields.name: PanTilt
fields.description: Pan and tilt speed. The x component corresponds to pan and the y component to tilt. If omitted in a request, the current (if any) PanTilt movement should not be affected.

fields.name: Zoom
fields.description: A zoom speed. If omitted in a request, the current (if any) Zoom movement should not be affected.

fields.name: space
fields.description: Pan/tilt coordinate space selector. The following options are defined: http://www.onvif.org/ver10/tptz/PanTiltSpaces/PositionGenericSpace http://www.onvif.org/ver10/tptz/PanTiltSpaces/TranslationGenericSpace http://www.onvif.org/ver10/tptz/PanTiltSpaces/VelocityGenericSpace http://www.onvif.org/ver10/tptz/PanTiltSpaces/GenericSpeedSpace

fields.name: space
fields.description: Zoom coordinate space selector. The following options are defined: http://www.onvif.org/ver10/tptz/ZoomSpaces/PositionGenericSpace http://www.onvif.org/ver10/tptz/ZoomSpaces/TranslationGenericSpace http://www.onvif.org/ver10/tptz/ZoomSpaces/VelocityGenericSpace http://www.onvif.org/ver10/tptz/ZoomSpaces/ZoomGenericSpeedSpace

fields.name: Range
fields.description: A range of pan tilt limits.

fields.name: URI
fields.description: A URI of coordinate systems.

fields.name: XRange
fields.description: A range of x-axis.

fields.name: YRange
fields.description: A range of y-axis.

fields.name: Range
fields.description: A range of zoom limit

fields.name: URI
fields.description: A URI of coordinate systems.

fields.name: XRange
fields.description: A range of x-axis.

fields.name: PTControlDirection
fields.description: Optional element to configure PT Control Direction related features.

fields.name: EFlip
fields.description: Optional element to configure related parameters for E-Flip.

fields.name: Reverse
fields.description: Optional element to configure related parameters for reversing of PT Control Direction.

fields.name: Mode
fields.description: Parameter to enable/disable E-Flip feature.

fields.name: Mode
fields.description: Parameter to enable/disable Reverse feature.

fields.name: PTZStatus
fields.description: optional element to configure which PTZ related data is to include in the metadata stream

fields.name: Events
fields.description: Optional element to configure the streaming of events. A client might be interested in receiving all, none or some of the events produced by the device:To get all events: Include the Events element but do not include a filter.To get no events: Do not include the Events element.To get only some events: Include the Events element and include a filter in the element.

fields.name: Analytics
fields.description: Defines whether the streamed metadata will include metadata from the analytics engines (video, cell motion, audio etc.)

fields.name: Multicast
fields.description: Defines the multicast settings that could be used for video streaming.

fields.name: SessionTimeout
fields.description: The rtsp session timeout for the related audio stream (when using Media2 Service, this value is deprecated and ignored)

fields.name: AnalyticsEngineConfiguration
fields.description: Indication which AnalyticsModules shall output metadata.Note that the streaming behavior is undefined if the list includes items that are not part of the associated AnalyticsConfiguration.

fields.name: CompressionType
fields.description: Optional parameter to configure compression type of Metadata payload. Use values from enumeration MetadataCompressionType.

fields.name: GeoLocation
fields.description: Optional parameter to configure if the metadata stream shall contain the Geo Location coordinates of each target.

fields.name: ShapePolygon
fields.description: Optional parameter to configure if the generated metadata stream should contain shape information as polygon.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: User readable name. Length up to 64 characters.

fields.name: UseCount
fields.description: Number of internal references currently using this configuration. This informational parameter is read-only. Deprecated for Media2 Service.

fields.name: token
fields.description: Token that uniquely references this configuration. Length up to 64 characters.

fields.name: Status
fields.description: True if the metadata stream shall contain the PTZ status (IDLE, MOVING or UNKNOWN)

fields.name: Position
fields.description: True if the metadata stream shall contain the PTZ position

fields.name: FieldOfView
fields.description: True if the metadata stream shall contain the field-of-view information

fields.name: AudioOutputConfiguration
fields.description: Optional configuration of the Audio output.

fields.name: AudioDecoderConfiguration
fields.description: Optional configuration of the Audio decoder.

fields.name: OutputToken
fields.description: Token of the phsycial Audio output.

fields.name: SendPrimacy
fields.description: An audio channel MAY support different types of audio transmission. While for full duplexoperation no special handling is required, in half duplex operation the transmission directionneeds to be switched.The optional SendPrimacy parameter inside the AudioOutputConfiguration indicates whichdirection is currently active. An NVC can switch between different modes by setting theAudioOutputConfiguration.The following modes for the Send-Primacy are defined:www.onvif.org/ver20/HalfDuplex/ServerThe server is allowed to send audio data to the client. The client shall not sendaudio data via the backchannel to the NVT in this mode.www.onvif.org/ver20/HalfDuplex/ClientThe client is allowed to send audio data via the backchannel to the server. TheNVT shall not send audio data to the client in this mode.www.onvif.org/ver20/HalfDuplex/AutoIt is up to the device how to deal with sending and receiving audio data.Acoustic echo cancellation is out of ONVIF scope.

fields.name: OutputLevel
fields.description: Volume setting of the output. The applicable range is defined via the option AudioOutputOptions.OutputLevelRange.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: User readable name. Length up to 64 characters.

fields.name: UseCount
fields.description: Number of internal references currently using this configuration. This informational parameter is read-only. Deprecated for Media2 Service.

fields.name: token
fields.description: Token that uniquely references this configuration. Length up to 64 characters.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: User readable name. Length up to 64 characters.

fields.name: UseCount
fields.description: Number of internal references currently using this configuration. This informational parameter is read-only. Deprecated for Media2 Service.

fields.name: token
fields.description: Token that uniquely references this configuration. Length up to 64 characters.

fields.name: Profiles
fields.description: lists all profiles that exist in the media service

fields.name: Name
fields.description: friendly name of the profile to be created

fields.name: Token
fields.description: Optional token, specifying the unique identifier of the new profile. A device supports at least a token length of 12 characters and characters 'A-Z' | 'a-z' | '0-9' | '-.'.

fields.name: Profile
fields.description: returns the new created profile

fields.name: ProfileToken
fields.description: This element contains a  reference to the profile that should be deleted.

fields.name: ConfigurationToken
fields.description: Token of the requested video encoder configuration.

fields.name: Configuration
fields.description: The requested video encoder configuration.

fields.name: Configurations
fields.description: This element contains a list of video encoder configurations.

fields.name: ProfileToken
fields.description: Reference to the profile where the configuration should be added

fields.name: ConfigurationToken
fields.description: Contains a reference to the VideoEncoderConfiguration to add

fields.name: ProfileToken
fields.description: Contains a reference to the media profile from which theVideoEncoderConfiguration shall be removed.

fields.name: Configuration
fields.description: Contains the modified video encoder configuration. The configuration shall exist in the device.

fields.name: ForcePersistence
fields.description: The ForcePersistence element is obsolete and should always be assumed to be true.

fields.name: ProfileToken
fields.description: Contains the token of an existing media profile the configurations shall be compatible with.

fields.name: Configurations
fields.description: Contains a list of video encoder configurations that are compatible with the specified media profile.

fields.name: ConfigurationToken
fields.description: Optional video encoder configuration token that specifies an existing configuration that the options are intended for.

fields.name: ProfileToken
fields.description: Optional ProfileToken that specifies an existing media profile that the options shall be compatible with.

fields.name: QualityRange
fields.description: Range of the quality values. A high value means higher quality.

fields.name: JPEG
fields.description: Optional JPEG encoder settings ranges (See also Extension element).

fields.name: MPEG4
fields.description: Optional MPEG-4 encoder settings ranges (See also Extension element).

fields.name: H264
fields.description: Optional H.264 encoder settings ranges (See also Extension element).

fields.name: GuaranteedFrameRateSupported
fields.description: Indicates the support for the GuaranteedFrameRate attribute on the VideoEncoderConfiguration element.

fields.name: ResolutionsAvailable
fields.description: List of supported image sizes.

fields.name: FrameRateRange
fields.description: Supported frame rate in fps (frames per second).

fields.name: EncodingIntervalRange
fields.description: Supported encoding interval range. The encoding interval corresponds to the number of frames devided by the encoded frames. An encoding interval value of '1' means that all frames are encoded.

fields.name: ResolutionsAvailable
fields.description: List of supported image sizes.

fields.name: GovLengthRange
fields.description: Supported group of Video frames length. This value typically corresponds to the I-Frame distance.

fields.name: FrameRateRange
fields.description: Supported frame rate in fps (frames per second).

fields.name: EncodingIntervalRange
fields.description: Supported encoding interval range. The encoding interval corresponds to the number of frames devided by the encoded frames. An encoding interval value of '1' means that all frames are encoded.

fields.name: Mpeg4ProfilesSupported
fields.description: List of supported MPEG-4 profiles.

fields.name: ResolutionsAvailable
fields.description: List of supported image sizes.

fields.name: GovLengthRange
fields.description: Supported group of Video frames length. This value typically corresponds to the I-Frame distance.

fields.name: FrameRateRange
fields.description: Supported frame rate in fps (frames per second).

fields.name: EncodingIntervalRange
fields.description: Supported encoding interval range. The encoding interval corresponds to the number of frames devided by the encoded frames. An encoding interval value of '1' means that all frames are encoded.

fields.name: H264ProfilesSupported
fields.description: List of supported H.264 profiles.

fields.name: JPEG
fields.description: Optional JPEG encoder settings ranges.

fields.name: MPEG4
fields.description: Optional MPEG-4 encoder settings ranges.

fields.name: H264
fields.description: Optional H.264 encoder settings ranges.

fields.name: BitrateRange
fields.description: Supported range of encoded bitrate in kbps.

fields.name: ResolutionsAvailable
fields.description: List of supported image sizes.

fields.name: FrameRateRange
fields.description: Supported frame rate in fps (frames per second).

fields.name: EncodingIntervalRange
fields.description: Supported encoding interval range. The encoding interval corresponds to the number of frames devided by the encoded frames. An encoding interval value of '1' means that all frames are encoded.

fields.name: BitrateRange
fields.description: Supported range of encoded bitrate in kbps.

fields.name: ResolutionsAvailable
fields.description: List of supported image sizes.

fields.name: GovLengthRange
fields.description: Supported group of Video frames length. This value typically corresponds to the I-Frame distance.

fields.name: FrameRateRange
fields.description: Supported frame rate in fps (frames per second).

fields.name: EncodingIntervalRange
fields.description: Supported encoding interval range. The encoding interval corresponds to the number of frames devided by the encoded frames. An encoding interval value of '1' means that all frames are encoded.

fields.name: Mpeg4ProfilesSupported
fields.description: List of supported MPEG-4 profiles.

fields.name: BitrateRange
fields.description: Supported range of encoded bitrate in kbps.

fields.name: ResolutionsAvailable
fields.description: List of supported image sizes.

fields.name: GovLengthRange
fields.description: Supported group of Video frames length. This value typically corresponds to the I-Frame distance.

fields.name: FrameRateRange
fields.description: Supported frame rate in fps (frames per second).

fields.name: EncodingIntervalRange
fields.description: Supported encoding interval range. The encoding interval corresponds to the number of frames devided by the encoded frames. An encoding interval value of '1' means that all frames are encoded.

fields.name: H264ProfilesSupported
fields.description: List of supported H.264 profiles.

fields.name: ConfigurationToken
fields.description: Token of the video source configuration

fields.name: TotalNumber
fields.description: The minimum guaranteed total number of encoder instances (applications) per VideoSourceConfiguration. The device is able to deliver the TotalNumber of streams

fields.name: JPEG
fields.description: If a device limits the number of instances for respective Video Codecs the response contains the information how many Jpeg streams can be set up at the same time per VideoSource.

fields.name: H264
fields.description: If a device limits the number of instances for respective Video Codecs the response contains the information how many H264 streams can be set up at the same time per VideoSource.

fields.name: MPEG4
fields.description: If a device limits the number of instances for respective Video Codecs the response contains the information how many Mpeg4 streams can be set up at the same time per VideoSource.

fields.name: VideoSources
fields.description: List of existing Video Sources

fields.name: Framerate
fields.description: Frame rate in frames per second.

fields.name: Resolution
fields.description: Horizontal and vertical resolution

fields.name: Imaging
fields.description: Optional configuration of the image sensor.

fields.name: token
fields.description: Unique identifier referencing the physical entity.

fields.name: BacklightCompensation
fields.description: Enabled/disabled BLC mode (on/off).

fields.name: Brightness
fields.description: Image brightness (unit unspecified).

fields.name: ColorSaturation
fields.description: Color saturation of the image (unit unspecified).

fields.name: Contrast
fields.description: Contrast of the image (unit unspecified).

fields.name: Exposure
fields.description: Exposure mode of the device.

fields.name: Focus
fields.description: Focus configuration.

fields.name: IrCutFilter
fields.description: Infrared Cutoff Filter settings.

fields.name: Sharpness
fields.description: Sharpness of the Video image.

fields.name: WideDynamicRange
fields.description: WDR settings.

fields.name: WhiteBalance
fields.description: White balance settings.

fields.name: Mode
fields.description: Backlight compensation mode (on/off).

fields.name: Level
fields.description: Optional level parameter (unit unspecified).

fields.name: Mode
fields.description: Exposure ModeAuto â€“ Enabled the exposure algorithm on the NVT.Manual â€“ Disabled exposure algorithm on the NVT.

fields.name: Priority
fields.description: The exposure priority mode (low noise/framerate).

fields.name: Window
fields.description: Rectangular exposure mask.

fields.name: MinExposureTime
fields.description: Minimum value of exposure time range allowed to be used by the algorithm.

fields.name: MaxExposureTime
fields.description: Maximum value of exposure time range allowed to be used by the algorithm.

fields.name: MinGain
fields.description: Minimum value of the sensor gain range that is allowed to be used by the algorithm.

fields.name: MaxGain
fields.description: Maximum value of the sensor gain range that is allowed to be used by the algorithm.

fields.name: MinIris
fields.description: Minimum value of the iris range allowed to be used by the algorithm.

fields.name: MaxIris
fields.description: Maximum value of the iris range allowed to be used by the algorithm.

fields.name: ExposureTime
fields.description: The fixed exposure time used by the image sensor (Î¼s).

fields.name: Gain
fields.description: The fixed gain used by the image sensor (dB).

fields.name: Iris
fields.description: The fixed attenuation of input light affected by the iris (dB). 0dB maps to a fully opened iris.

fields.name: NearLimit
fields.description: Parameter to set autofocus near limit (unit: meter).

fields.name: FarLimit
fields.description: Parameter to set autofocus far limit (unit: meter).If set to 0.0, infinity will be used.

fields.name: Mode
fields.description: White dynamic range (on/off)

fields.name: Level
fields.description: Optional level parameter (unitless)

fields.name: Mode
fields.description: Auto whitebalancing mode (auto/manual).

fields.name: CrGain
fields.description: Rgain (unitless).

fields.name: CbGain
fields.description: Bgain (unitless).

fields.name: Imaging
fields.description: Optional configuration of the image sensor. To be used if imaging service 2.00 is supported.

fields.name: BacklightCompensation
fields.description: Enabled/disabled BLC mode (on/off).

fields.name: Brightness
fields.description: Image brightness (unit unspecified).

fields.name: ColorSaturation
fields.description: Color saturation of the image (unit unspecified).

fields.name: Contrast
fields.description: Contrast of the image (unit unspecified).

fields.name: Exposure
fields.description: Exposure mode of the device.

fields.name: Focus
fields.description: Focus configuration.

fields.name: IrCutFilter
fields.description: Infrared Cutoff Filter settings.

fields.name: Sharpness
fields.description: Sharpness of the Video image.

fields.name: WideDynamicRange
fields.description: WDR settings.

fields.name: WhiteBalance
fields.description: White balance settings.

fields.name: Mode
fields.description: Backlight compensation mode (on/off).

fields.name: Level
fields.description: Optional level parameter (unit unspecified).

fields.name: Mode
fields.description: Exposure ModeAuto â€“ Enabled the exposure algorithm on the device.Manual â€“ Disabled exposure algorithm on the device.

fields.name: Priority
fields.description: The exposure priority mode (low noise/framerate).

fields.name: Window
fields.description: Rectangular exposure mask.

fields.name: MinExposureTime
fields.description: Minimum value of exposure time range allowed to be used by the algorithm.

fields.name: MaxExposureTime
fields.description: Maximum value of exposure time range allowed to be used by the algorithm.

fields.name: MinGain
fields.description: Minimum value of the sensor gain range that is allowed to be used by the algorithm.

fields.name: MaxGain
fields.description: Maximum value of the sensor gain range that is allowed to be used by the algorithm.

fields.name: MinIris
fields.description: Minimum value of the iris range allowed to be used by the algorithm.  0dB maps to a fully opened iris and positive values map to higher attenuation.

fields.name: MaxIris
fields.description: Maximum value of the iris range allowed to be used by the algorithm. 0dB maps to a fully opened iris and positive values map to higher attenuation.

fields.name: ExposureTime
fields.description: The fixed exposure time used by the image sensor (Î¼s).

fields.name: Gain
fields.description: The fixed gain used by the image sensor (dB).

fields.name: Iris
fields.description: The fixed attenuation of input light affected by the iris (dB). 0dB maps to a fully opened iris and positive values map to higher attenuation.

fields.name: AutoFocusMode
fields.description: Mode of auto focus.AUTO - The device automatically adjusts focus.MANUAL - The device does not automatically adjust focus.Note: for devices supporting both manual and auto operation at the same time manual operation may be supported even if the Mode parameter is set to Auto.

fields.name: NearLimit
fields.description: Parameter to set autofocus near limit (unit: meter).

fields.name: FarLimit
fields.description: Parameter to set autofocus far limit (unit: meter).

fields.name: AFMode
fields.description: Zero or more modes as defined in enumeration tt:AFModes.

fields.name: Mode
fields.description: Wide dynamic range mode (on/off).

fields.name: Level
fields.description: Optional level parameter (unit unspecified).

fields.name: Mode
fields.description: 'AUTO' or 'MANUAL'

fields.name: CrGain
fields.description: Rgain (unitless).

fields.name: CbGain
fields.description: Bgain (unitless).

fields.name: ImageStabilization
fields.description: Optional element to configure Image Stabilization feature.

fields.name: Mode
fields.description: Parameter to enable/disable Image Stabilization feature.

fields.name: Level
fields.description: Optional level parameter (unit unspecified)

fields.name: IrCutFilterAutoAdjustment
fields.description: An optional parameter applied to only auto mode to adjust timing of toggling Ir cut filter.

fields.name: BoundaryType
fields.description: Specifies which boundaries to automatically toggle Ir cut filter following parameters are applied to. Its options shall be chosen from tt:IrCutFilterAutoBoundaryType.

fields.name: BoundaryOffset
fields.description: Adjusts boundary exposure level for toggling Ir cut filter to on/off specified with unitless normalized value from +1.0 to -1.0. Zero is default and -1.0 is the darkest adjustment (Unitless).

fields.name: ResponseTime
fields.description: Delay time of toggling Ir cut filter to on/off after crossing of the boundary exposure levels.

fields.name: ToneCompensation
fields.description: Optional element to configure Image Contrast Compensation.

fields.name: Defogging
fields.description: Optional element to configure Image Defogging.

fields.name: NoiseReduction
fields.description: Optional element to configure Image Noise Reduction.

fields.name: Mode
fields.description: Parameter to enable/disable or automatic ToneCompensation feature. Its options shall be chosen from tt:ToneCompensationMode Type.

fields.name: Level
fields.description: Optional level parameter specified with unitless normalized value from 0.0 to +1.0.

fields.name: Mode
fields.description: Parameter to enable/disable or automatic Defogging feature. Its options shall be chosen from tt:DefoggingMode Type.

fields.name: Level
fields.description: Optional level parameter specified with unitless normalized value from 0.0 to +1.0.

fields.name: Level
fields.description: Level parameter specified with unitless normalized value from 0.0 to +1.0. Level=0 means no noise reduction or minimal noise reduction.

fields.name: ConfigurationToken
fields.description: Token of the requested video source configuration.

fields.name: Configuration
fields.description: The requested video source configuration.

fields.name: Configurations
fields.description: This element contains a list of video source configurations.

fields.name: ProfileToken
fields.description: Reference to the profile where the configuration should be added

fields.name: ConfigurationToken
fields.description: Contains a reference to the VideoSourceConfiguration to add

fields.name: ProfileToken
fields.description: Contains a reference to the media profile from which theVideoSourceConfiguration shall be removed.

fields.name: Configuration
fields.description: Contains the modified video source configuration. The configuration shall exist in the device.

fields.name: ForcePersistence
fields.description: The ForcePersistence element is obsolete and should always be assumed to be true.

fields.name: ProfileToken
fields.description: Contains the token of an existing media profile the configurations shall be compatible with.

fields.name: Configurations
fields.description: Contains a list of video source configurations that are compatible with the specified media profile.

fields.name: ConfigurationToken
fields.description: Optional video source configurationToken that specifies an existing configuration that the options are intended for.

fields.name: ProfileToken
fields.description: Optional ProfileToken that specifies an existing media profile that the options shall be compatible with.

fields.name: Options
fields.description: This message contains the video source configuration options. If a video source configuration is specified, the options shall concern that particular configuration. If a media profile is specified, the options shall be compatible with that media profile. If no tokens are specified, the options shall be considered generic for the device.

fields.name: BoundsRange
fields.description: Supported range for the capturing area.Device that does not support cropped streaming shall express BoundsRange option as mentioned belowBoundsRange->XRange and BoundsRange->YRange with same Min/Max values HeightRange and WidthRange Min/Max values same as VideoSource Height and Width Limits.

fields.name: VideoSourceTokensAvailable
fields.description: List of physical inputs.

fields.name: MaximumNumberOfProfiles
fields.description: Maximum number of profiles.

fields.name: XRange
fields.description: Range of X-axis.

fields.name: YRange
fields.description: Range of Y-axis.

fields.name: WidthRange
fields.description: Range of width.

fields.name: HeightRange
fields.description: Range of height.

fields.name: Rotate
fields.description: Options of parameters for Rotation feature.

fields.name: Mode
fields.description: Supported options of Rotate mode parameter.

fields.name: DegreeList
fields.description: List of supported degree value for rotation.

fields.name: Reboot
fields.description: Signals if a device requires a reboot after changing the rotation.If a device can handle rotation changes without rebooting this value shall be set to false.

fields.name: SceneOrientationMode
fields.description: Scene orientation modes supported by the device for this configuration.

fields.name: ConfigurationToken
fields.description: Token of the requested metadata configuration.

fields.name: Configuration
fields.description: The requested metadata configuration.

fields.name: Configurations
fields.description: This element contains a list of metadata configurations

fields.name: ProfileToken
fields.description: Contains the token of an existing media profile the configurations shall be compatible with.

fields.name: Configurations
fields.description: Contains a list of metadata configurations that are compatible with the specified media profile.

fields.name: ProfileToken
fields.description: Reference to the profile where the configuration should be added

fields.name: ConfigurationToken
fields.description: Contains a reference to the MetadataConfiguration to add

fields.name: Configuration
fields.description: Contains the modified metadata configuration. The configuration shall exist in the device.

fields.name: ForcePersistence
fields.description: The ForcePersistence element is obsolete and should always be assumed to be true.

fields.name: ProfileToken
fields.description: Contains a reference to the media profile from which theMetadataConfiguration shall be removed.

fields.name: ConfigurationToken
fields.description: Optional metadata configuration token that specifies an existing configuration that the options are intended for.

fields.name: ProfileToken
fields.description: Optional ProfileToken that specifies an existing media profile that the options shall be compatible with.

fields.name: Options
fields.description: This message contains the metadata configuration options. If a metadata configuration is specified, the options shall concern that particular configuration. If a media profile is specified, the options shall be compatible with that media profile. If no tokens are specified, the options shall be considered generic for the device.

fields.name: GeoLocation
fields.description: True if the device is able to stream the Geo Located positions of each target.

fields.name: MaxContentFilterSize
fields.description: A device signalling support for content filtering shall support expressions with the provided expression size.

fields.name: PanTiltStatusSupported
fields.description: True if the device is able to stream pan or tilt status information.

fields.name: ZoomStatusSupported
fields.description: True if the device is able to stream zoom status inforamtion.

fields.name: PanTiltPositionSupported
fields.description: True if the device is able to stream the pan or tilt position.

fields.name: ZoomPositionSupported
fields.description: True if the device is able to stream zoom position information.

fields.name: FieldOfViewSupported
fields.description: True if the device is able to stream the field-of-view information.

fields.name: CompressionType
fields.description: List of supported metadata compression type. Its options shall be chosen from tt:MetadataCompressionType.

fields.name: ProfileToken
fields.description: Contains a Profile reference for which a Synchronization Point is requested.

fields.name: ProfileToken
fields.description: Reference to the profile where the configuration should be added

fields.name: ConfigurationToken
fields.description: Contains a reference to the PTZConfiguration to add

fields.name: ProfileToken
fields.description: Contains a reference to the media profile from which thePTZConfiguration shall be removed.

fields.name: AudioSources
fields.description: List of existing Audio Sources

fields.name: Channels
fields.description: number of available audio channels. (1: mono, 2: stereo)

fields.name: token
fields.description: Unique identifier referencing the physical entity.

fields.name: ConfigurationToken
fields.description: Token of the requested audio source configuration.

fields.name: Configuration
fields.description: The requested audio source configuration.

fields.name: Configurations
fields.description: This element contains a list of audio source configurations.

fields.name: ProfileToken
fields.description: Reference to the profile where the configuration should be added

fields.name: ConfigurationToken
fields.description: Contains a reference to the AudioSourceConfiguration to add

fields.name: ProfileToken
fields.description: Contains a reference to the media profile from which theAudioSourceConfiguration shall be removed.

fields.name: Configuration
fields.description: Contains the modified audio source configuration. The configuration shall exist in the device.

fields.name: ForcePersistence
fields.description: The ForcePersistence element is obsolete and should always be assumed to be true.

fields.name: ConfigurationToken
fields.description: Optional audio source configuration token that specifies an existing configuration that the options are intended for.

fields.name: ProfileToken
fields.description: Optional ProfileToken that specifies an existing media profile that the options shall be compatible with.

fields.name: Options
fields.description: This message contains the audio source configuration options. If a audio source configuration is specified, the options shall concern that particular configuration. If a media profile is specified, the options shall be compatible with that media profile. If no tokens are specified, the options shall be considered generic for the device.

fields.name: InputTokensAvailable
fields.description: Tokens of the audio source the configuration can be used for.

fields.name: ProfileToken
fields.description: Contains the token of an existing media profile the configurations shall be compatible with.

fields.name: Configurations
fields.description: Contains a list of audio source configurations that are compatible with the specified media profile.

fields.name: ConfigurationToken
fields.description: Token of the requested audio encoder configuration.

fields.name: Configuration
fields.description: The requested audio encoder configuration

fields.name: Configurations
fields.description: This element contains a list of audio encoder configurations.

fields.name: ProfileToken
fields.description: Reference to the profile where the configuration should be added

fields.name: ConfigurationToken
fields.description: Contains a reference to the AudioEncoderConfiguration to add

fields.name: ProfileToken
fields.description: Contains a reference to the media profile from which theAudioEncoderConfiguration shall be removed.

fields.name: Configuration
fields.description: Contains the modified audio encoder configuration. The configuration shall exist in the device.

fields.name: ForcePersistence
fields.description: The ForcePersistence element is obsolete and should always be assumed to be true.

fields.name: ProfileToken
fields.description: Contains the token of an existing media profile the configurations shall be compatible with.

fields.name: Configurations
fields.description: Contains a list of audio encoder configurations that are compatible with the specified media profile.

fields.name: ConfigurationToken
fields.description: Optional audio encoder configuration token that specifies an existing configuration that the options are intended for.

fields.name: ProfileToken
fields.description: Optional ProfileToken that specifies an existing media profile that the options shall be compatible with.

fields.name: Options
fields.description: This message contains the audio encoder configuration options. If a audio encoder configuration is specified, the options shall concern that particular configuration. If a media profile is specified, the options shall be compatible with that media profile. If no tokens are specified, the options shall be considered generic for the device.

fields.name: Options
fields.description: list of supported AudioEncoderConfigurations

fields.name: Encoding
fields.description: The enoding used for audio data (either G.711, G.726 or AAC)

fields.name: BitrateList
fields.description: List of supported bitrates in kbps for the specified Encoding

fields.name: SampleRateList
fields.description: List of supported Sample Rates in kHz for the specified Encoding

fields.name: ProfileToken
fields.description: Contains the token of the Profile that is used to define the multicast stream.

fields.name: IpAddressType
fields.description: Indicates if the address is an IPv4 or IPv6 address.

fields.name: IPv4Address
fields.description: IPv4 address.

fields.name: IPv6Address
fields.description: IPv6 address

fields.name: Parameters
fields.description: List of configuration parameters as defined in the corresponding description.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Name of the configuration.

fields.name: ConfigType
fields.description: The Type attribute specifies the type of rule and shall be equal to value of one of Name attributes of ConfigDescription elements returned by GetSupportedRules and GetSupportedAnalyticsModules command.

fields.name: Filter
fields.description: Optional filter to configure the streaming of events.

fields.name: SubscriptionPolicy
fields.description: Optional subscription policy.

fields.name: SimpleItem
fields.description: Value name pair as defined by the corresponding description.

fields.name: ElementItem
fields.description: Complex value structure.
